nodes.bodyText: So the user can only pass in one scope? I believe you can actually use Set<ArtifactScope> artifactScopes to allow multiple scopes to be passed from the query param. Also, better not to have - in the query param name, as it is used as the query parameter name passed in the URI.
Don't "consider", as the meaning is not clear. Call it allowSnapshot
The type can be boolean We support all primitive types and collections in query param
Wrong alignment.
Also, seems like the conditions can be combined. The IntelliJ IDE probably already suggesting it?
Use orElseThrow instead of isPresent
Throw with ArtifactNotFoundException exception with the ArtifactId in the constructor. The message is already formatted by the exception, no need to use a custom message.
You don't need the @DefaultValue. Primitive are default to be false.
I think it will never be null if the type is a Collection. Please validate and remove the @Nullable if that's the case.
Refactor this block to a private method. You can modify the validateScope to validateScopes for that purpose.

Instead of modify an existing method (this is public API), add overloaded method that take extra parameters and have the original method calls the newly added one.
Also, use empty set instead of null for collection.
